official-title.#text:
For the relief of Maria Carmen Castro Ramirez and J.
		  Refugio Carreno Rojas.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced

header.#text:
Permanent resident status for
			 Maria Carmen Castro Ramirez and J. Refugio Carreno Rojas

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 Maria Carmen Castro Ramirez and J. Refugio Carreno Rojas shall each be eligible
			 for issuance of an immigrant visa or for adjustment of status to that of an
			 alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence upon filing an application for
			 issuance of an immigrant visa under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: (b) of section 201 of the Immigration and Nationality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or for adjustment
			 of status to lawful permanent resident.

, he or she shall be considered to have
			 entered and remained lawfully and shall, if otherwise eligible, be eligible for
			 adjustment of status under
as of the date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 245 of the Immigration and Nationality Act

text.#text:
If Maria Carmen Castro
			 Ramirez or J. Refugio Carreno Rojas enters the United States before the filing
			 deadline specified in

header.#text:
Waiver of
			 Grounds for Removal or Denial of Admission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, Maria Carmen
			 Castro Ramirez and J. Refugio Carreno Rojas may not be removed from the United
			 States, denied admission to the United States, or considered ineligible for
			 lawful permanent residence in the United States by reason of any ground for
			 removal or denial of admission that is reflected in the records of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: 237(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: on the date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Visa Office of the Department of State

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 rescind any outstanding order of removal or deportation, or any finding of
			 inadmissibility or deportability, that has been entered against Maria Carmen
			 Castro Ramirez or J. Refugio Carreno Rojas by reason of any ground described in

header.#text:
Rescission of
			 outstanding order of removal

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 apply only if the application for issuance of an immigrant visa or the
			 application for adjustment of status is filed with appropriate fees within 2
			 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

header.#text:
Deadline for
			 Application and Payment of Fees

or, if applicable, the total number of immigrant visas that are

section 203(a) of the Immigration and
